page.title: 07BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY.ECOLOGY 1.
page.content: A designated area of great natural beauty. Tidal estuary. Coastal road & marshes flood at high tides. Shifting river channels; salt marsh; sand banks; gravel pits; peat deposits ; plants. Many beautiful flowers on the various habitats include: Thrift; Sea Campion; Sandwort; Harebells; Orchids; Sundews, also mushrooms. Old hedges shelter much wildlife and climbing plants include Honeysuckle, Rose, Blackberry. Gales cause damage to garden trees, fences and roofs. Weather: windy, mild winters; good sunshine record (usually). Ice caused collapse of rail viaduct across Firth to Annan. Big floes often pile along the shore in bad winters. Wath (ford) used formerly for cattle droving. The South end of the viaduct is appropriately named Herdhill.
